Puffballs I (Hyphan).name: Puffballs I (Hyphan)
Puffballs I (Hyphan).description:
Prerequisite: 5th-level tamer

Type: Active (action)

As an action, the hyphan can cause two 10-foot squares of dirt, rock, or wood it can see within 60 feet of it to sprout tiny puffball mushrooms, which last for 1 hour or until the hyphan dismisses them as an action. The squares must be contiguous with one another.

When a creature enters the area, the 10-foot square of puffballs explodes, disappearing into a cloud of spores. Each non-hyphan creature in the area or within 5 feet of the area must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage 2d12 necrotic average]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

After the hyphan uses this action, it can’t do so again until the tamer finishes a short or long rest.

When the hyphan’s tamer reaches 9th level in the tamer class, the hyphan can create one additional 10-foot square of puffballs (three total), and the damage increases to [[/damage 3d12 average]].

Ring of Fungal Symbiosis (Very Rare).name: Ring of Fungal Symbiosis (Very Rare)
Ring of Fungal Symbiosis (Very Rare).description:
Ring, very rare (optional attunement)

Component: Plant (hyphan) pouch of spores

Parasite or symbiote, the exact classification of this loop of living fungus is up for debate. When worn for an extended period, the ring co-opts its host, produc ing an assortment of fruiting fungal bodies each day. Whether those are of benefit or not is entirely up to how they’re used.

Whenever you finish a long rest during which you wear this ring, you find a selection of toadstools have grown on the limb that sports this ring. Roll a [[/r d6]] twice and consult the list below to determine which two mushrooms have grown.

  • Boomshroom. As an action a creature can throw this volatile mushroom at a point it can see within 60 feet of it, where it explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in the area must make a [[/save dex dc= 16 format=long]], taking [[/damage fire 4d6]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried.
  • Bloomshroom. As an action a creature can eat this mushroom, regaining [[/healing 2d4 + 2]] hit points and gaining advantage on all Constitution saving throws for 1 minute.
  • Doomshroom. As an action a creature can throw this dusky mushroom at a point it can see within 60 feet of it, where it explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere of purple spores. Each creature in the area must succeed on a [[/save con dc= 16 format=long]] or become afflicted by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.95K2aUhAGV9qXjnf]{Bane} spell for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect for it on a success.
  • Gloomshroom. As an action a creature can eat this mushroom. For the next hour, it gains @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.eVtpEGXjA2tamEIJ.JournalEntryPage.0RBamBThjzeAdMSt]{Darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If it already has @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.eVtpEGXjA2tamEIJ.JournalEntryPage.0RBamBThjzeAdMSt]{Darkvision}, the range of this vision is extended by 30 feet.
  • Zoomshroom. As an action a creature can eat this mushroom, gaining the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Szvk5FEVQW3uhJi5]{Haste} spell for 1 minute. At the start of each of the affected creature’s turns, roll a [[/r d6]]. On a 1, the effect ends and the wave of lethargy described in the spell sweeps over it.
  • Rheumshroom. As an action, a creature can throw this sticky mushroom at a point it can see within 60 feet of it, where it explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere of arthritis-inducing spores. Each creature in the area must succeed on a [[/save con dc=16 format=long]] or suffer the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.yqUDoxk4x0NWG5Bz]{Slow} spell for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect for it on a success.

The mushrooms last on your arm until you next finish a long rest, but lose all magical effects after 10 minutes after they are plucked. You can pluck a mushroom as part of the action to use it.

Optional Attunement. You can choose to attune to this item. While attuned, you can roll the d6 to determine which mushrooms grow four times instead of twice. In addition, while attuned to the ring, the ring gains the Fungal Plating property.

OA: Fungal Plating. When you finish a long rest while wearing the ring, hard sheets of organic mycoprotein cover your body. You gain the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.JPwIEfgUPVebr5AH]{Barkskin} spell for the next 24 hours (no concentration required). While this magical effect persists, you gain 5 temporary hit points at the start of each of your turns.

Foundry Note

Use the Fungal Plating activity for both applying the effect to an actor and to apply temporary hit points at the start of each turn.

Bane.name: 灾祸
Bane.description: 在法术结束前，该目标进行的攻击检定或豁免检定都必须从检定结果中减去 1d4。

Slow.name: 缓慢
Slow.description: 你的速度减半，而你的 AC 和敏捷豁免都具有 -2 减值，且不能执行反应。你在你的回合内可以执行一个动作或一个附赠动作，但不能在一回合内同时执行以上两者。不论你拥有何种能力或魔法物品，你在你的回合内只能发动一次近战或远程攻击。

Haste.name: 加速术
Haste.description:
Until the spell ends, the target's speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity Saving Throws, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns. That action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.
At the start of each of the affected creature’s turns, roll a [[/r d6]]. On a 1, the effect ends and the wave of lethargy described in the spell sweeps over it.

Darkvision.name: 黑暗视觉
Darkvision.description: As an action a creature can eat this mushroom. For the next hour, it gains Darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If it already has Darkvision, the range of this vision is extended by 30 feet.

Fungal Plating.name: Fungal Plating
Fungal Plating.description: You gain 5 temporary hit points at the start of each of your turns.

Corrupting Ichor.name: Corrupting Ichor
Corrupting Ichor.description:
Class: Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

You spit a globule of phlegm at one creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes [[/damage]] damage. In addition, until it uses its action to wipe off the phlegm, it takes [[/r 1d4]] necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns and any hit points regained are reduced by half.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage at the start of the target’s next turn increases by [[/r 1d4]] for each slot level above 1st.

Corrupting Ichor phlegm.name: Corrupting Ichor phlegm
Corrupting Ichor phlegm.description:
In addition, until it uses its action to wipe off the phlegm, it takes 1d4 necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns and any hit points regained are reduced by half.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage at the start of the target’s next turn increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 1st.

Overgrown Barkshield (Uncommon).name: Overgrown Barkshield (Uncommon)
Overgrown Barkshield (Uncommon).description:
Armour (shield), uncommon (requires attunement)

Component: Plant (treant) bark

This crude shield made of bark and wood teems with life as if it were still part of a tree. The smell of sap and various fragrant flowers perfumes the air around you.

Bark Armour. As an action, you can place the shield on your torso and speak the command word causing the wood and vines to wrap around your figure. For one hour, or until you end this effect as an action, you are unable to hold a shield and you gain the following benefits:

  • You gain [[/healing]] hit points
  • You gain the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.JPwIEfgUPVebr5AH]{Barkskin} spell (no concentration required).
  • You have advantage on saving throws made to resist being poisoned.

When this effect ends, the barkshield falls from its place on your torso, fading to a lifeless shade of grey. This property can’t be used again until you finish a long rest, when the shield blooms with life once more.

Vines and Thorns. While attuned to this shield, you can use an action to animate one of the shields’ thorny vines. Make a melee weapon attack ([[/attack]] to hit) against one target within 30 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes [[/damage]] damage and, if the target is a Large or smaller creature, or an object then weighs less than 500 pounds, you pull it up to 10 feet closer to you.

Sporespreader Rod (Rare).name: Sporespreader Rod (Rare)
Sporespreader Rod (Rare).description:
Rod, staff, or wand, rare (requires attunement by a spellcaster)

Component: Plant (hyphan) spore-filled gills

Used as a magical focus of the more humanoid-esque, ‘customer-facing’ hyphan colonists, sporespreaders are enchanted to facilitate the calming and assimila tion of would-be interlopers. The magic in these foci can poison foes with infectious spores, or generate obscuring thick black clouds to allow their wielders to flee dangerous situations.

This focus has 10 charges and regains [[/r 1d6 + 4]] expended charges daily at dawn. While holding the sporespreader, you can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability:

  • @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.eS7XnnApoxRxYXPs]{Charm Person} (1 charge)
  • @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.3MYDjS6k9IYL0aTj]{Calm Emotions} (2 charges)
  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.l0oALTQuDQJE5vKv]{Enrage} (3 charges)
  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.Z4YoNd8AFxiLAkwW]{Mortiferous Pulse} (2 charges)

You can also cast the @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.kFs5m2XYcAUdCcx5]{Spore Cloud} and @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.MeAHICvn9eHG5Lml]{Smokescreen} cantrips from the focus without using any charges.

Growth (Hyphan).name: Growth (Hyphan)
Growth (Hyphan).description:
Prerequisite: 5th-level tamer

Type: Passive (companion)

The hyphan’s size increases to Small, its Hit Die size increases to a d6 (its hit point maximum consequently increases by 1 for each of its Hit Dice), and the damage of its Poison Spray increases to 2d12.

Infested Cultist's Skull (Uncommon).name: Infested Cultist's Skull (Uncommon)
Infested Cultist's Skull (Uncommon).description:
Wondrous item, uncommon

Component: Humanoid (cultist) bone

This humanoid skull is infested by a parasitic purple plant from an unknown plane. The longer you stare, the more you could swear that the petals sway in response to an unseen wind.

The skull contains 7 petals. While holding it, you can use an action to pluck a petal to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.7buEm5KhI5lP8m1z]{Guiding Bolt} spell (+5 to hit), dealing necrotic damage instead of radiant. The skull regrows [[/r 1d4]] plucked petals daily at dawn. If you pluck the last petal, the skull crumbles to dust and is destroyed.

Curse. This skull is cursed, and plucking 3 or more petals in a day extends this curse to you. Until the curse is broken with @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XZhdgVK3cLoxNCQl]{remove curse} or similar magic, you are unwilling to part with the skull, keeping it within reach at all times. 

While cursed, whenever you finish a long rest, a black petal grows on your head. These black petals cannot be removed physically, and any attempt to do so causes you to take [[/damage necrotic 2d6]] damage. If you travel to a different plane while cursed, you grow a further [[/r 1d4]] black petals.

When the seventh petal has grown on your skull, you die and your body turns to dust, except your skull which becomes a new infested cultist skull. If the curse is removed, the petals on your head and the infested cultist skull are destroyed and crumble to dust.

Helpful (Hyphan).name: Helpful (Hyphan)
Helpful (Hyphan).description:
Prerequisite: become a tamer’s companion

Type: Active (bonus action)

As a bonus action, the hyphan takes the Help action. The hyphan gains this improvement when it becomes a companion; it doesn’t cost an improvement.

Painblinder Mycaxe Battleaxe (Uncommon).name: Painblinder Mycaxe Battleaxe (Uncommon)
Painblinder Mycaxe Battleaxe (Uncommon).description:
Weapon (any axe), uncommon

Component: Plant (hyphan) spore-filled gills

The wood and iron of this once-pristine axe has been utterly devoured and replaced by a variety of fruiting fungi. Gills funnel the axe’s blade, holding millions of spores in biomantic suspension, ready to unleash their pain-inhibiting effects when inhaled.

Painblind Spores. As a bonus action while you hold this axe, you can inhale its spores, numbing your extremities and stimulating muscle recruitment. Until the start of your next turn, melee weapon attacks you make with this weapon have a +2 bonus to damage rolls and you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

If you use your bonus action to inhale more spores at the beginning of your next turn, the effects continue without interruption. You can prolong the effects in this manner for up to 1 minute, after which the effects end. When the effects end, you become &reference[poisoned] for a number of minutes equal to ten times the number of rounds you were under the influence of the spores. Once you have benefitted from the Painblind Spores, you can’t benefit from them again until after you finish a long rest.

Painblinder Spores (+2 Dam and Resistanc.name: Painblinder Spores (+2 Dam and Resistances)
Painblinder Spores (+2 Dam and Resistanc.description: Until the start of your next turn, melee weapon attacks you make with this weapon have a +2 bonus to damage rolls and you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

Smokescreen.name: Smokescreen
Smokescreen.description:
Class: Druid, Sorcerer, Tamer, Wizard

You spew a thick cloud of dense black smoke that forms a 5-foot-diameter, 10-foot-high cylinder centred on you that lasts until the start of your next turn. The smoke heavily obscures its area. When you cast the spell, you can choose whether the cloud remains in the location where you cast it or if it moves with you, centred on you.

When you reach higher levels, the size of the cloud you can create with this spell increases. When you reach 5th level, the cloud has a maximum diameter and height of 15 feet; at 11th level this increases to 25 feet; and at 17th level this increases to 40 feet. You choose how big the cloud is in each dimension up to this maximum each time that you cast it.

Detritivore (Hyphan).name: Detritivore (Hyphan)
Detritivore (Hyphan).description:
Prerequisite: 3rd-level tamer

Type: Active (action)

As an action, the hyphan can drain one Small or larger corpse within its reach, regaining hit points equal to twice its tamer’s level. Once the hyphan has used this action, it can’t do so again until its tamer finishes a long rest. A corpse can be drained by this or similar abilities only once.

Painblinder Mycaxe Battleaxe (Rare).description:

Painblinder Spores (+3 Dam and Resistanc.description: Until the start of your next turn, melee weapon attacks you make with this weapon have a +3 bonus to damage rolls and you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

Fungal Fruits (Hyphan).name: Fungal Fruits (Hyphan)
Fungal Fruits (Hyphan).description:
Prerequisite: 9th-level tamer

Type: Active (1 minute)

Over the course of a minute, the hyphan can grow a random assortment of mushrooms on its body. Each time it does this, roll a [[/r d4]] twice and consult the options below to determine which two mushrooms grow.

  1. Bloomshroom. As an action a creature can eat this mushroom, regaining [[/healing 2d4 + 2]] hit points and gaining advantage on all Constitution saving throws for 1 minute.
  2. Boomshroom. As an action a creature can throw this volatile mushroom at a point it can see within 60 feet of it, where it explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in the area must make a [[/save dex format=long]], taking [[/damage fire 4d6]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried.
  3. Doomshroom. As an action a creature can throw this dusky mushroom at a point it can see within 60 feet of it, where it explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere of purple spores. Each creature in the area must succeed on a [[/save con format=long]] or become afflicted by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.95K2aUhAGV9qXjnf]{Bane} spell for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect for it on a success.
  4. Gloomshroom. As an action a creature can eat this mushroom. For the next hour, it gains @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.eVtpEGXjA2tamEIJ.JournalEntryPage.0RBamBThjzeAdMSt]{Darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If it already has @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.eVtpEGXjA2tamEIJ.JournalEntryPage.0RBamBThjzeAdMSt]{Darkvision}, the range of this vision is extended by 30 feet.

The mushrooms last until the hyphan’s tamer next finishes a long rest, but lose all magical effects 10 minutes after they are plucked. You can pluck a mushroom as part of the action to use it. After the hyphan uses this trait, it can’t do so again until its tamer finishes a long rest.

Hallucispores (Hyphan).description:

The hyphan has a number of uses of this ability equal to its Constitution modifier (minimum 1) and regains all expended uses when its tamer finishes a long rest.

Hallucispores (Hyphan).name: Hallucispores (Hyphan)
Hallucispores (Hyphan).description: This creature is &Reference[charmed] until the end of its next turn.

Amanita Rotgut.name: Amanita Rotgut
Amanita Rotgut.description:
You can eat this mushroom as an action. When you do so, you immediately take [[/damage 2d6 poison]] damage and become &reference[poisoned] for 1 minute. After the minute elapses, you gain resistance to poison damage and are immune to the &reference[poisoned] condition for 1 hour.

Waning Potency. This mushroom loses its potency 1 hour after it was picked.

Amanita Rotgut.name: Amanita Rotgut
Amanita Rotgut.description: You have resistance to poison damage and are immune to the &Reference[poisoned] condition.

Psilocybin Kwikitrippiae.name: Psilocybin Kwikitrippiae
Psilocybin Kwikitrippiae.description:
You can eat this mushroom as an action. When you do so, you are immediately affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.9hQXdMSmerkTsHDe]{confusion} spell for 10 minutes. You can make a [[/save con dc=15 format=long]] at the end of each minute, ending the effect on a success. After the effect ends, you gain advantage on Wisdom saving throws for 1 hour.

Waning Potency. This mushroom loses its potency 1 hour after it was picked.

Confusion.name: 困惑术
Confusion.description: You are affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.9hQXdMSmerkTsHDe]{confusion} spell.

Psilocybin Kwikitrippiae.name: Psilocybin Kwikitrippiae
Psilocybin Kwikitrippiae.description: You have gain advantage on Wisdom saving throws for 1 hour.

Multihelp (Hyphan).name: Multihelp (Hyphan)
Multihelp (Hyphan).description:
Prerequisite: 13th-level tamer, Helpful

Type: Active (action)

When the hyphan takes the Disengage action, it can take the Help action up to three times on that turn as part of the same action. After it uses this action, it can’t do so again until its tamer finishes a short or long rest.

Longspike (Uncommon).name: Longspike (Uncommon)
Longspike (Uncommon).description:
Weapon (rapier), uncommon (optional attunement)

Component: Plant (hyphan) pouch of hyphae

The longspike grants its user the ability to strike from afar, without resorting to the use of unwieldy polearms. When grasped with force, the long, narrow blade extends, increasing the reach of its wielder’s thrust, and can implant a rapidly-growing net of hy phal tethers that can bind and constrict a foe.

Hyphal Stretch. On your turn, you can squeeze the longspike (no action required), causing it to lengthen and increasing the reach of melee attacks you make with it by 5 feet until the end of your turn.

Optional Attunement. You can choose to attune to this weapon, causing it to gain the Hyphal Grasp and Hyphal Parasite properties for the duration that you remain attuned to it.

OA: Hyphal Grasp. As a bonus action while holding the rapier, you can speak its command word to cause writhing hyphal filaments to grow from it. The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack using longspike within the next minute, the target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.cSVcyZyNe2iG1fIc]{Restrained} by the magical hyphae for 1 minute. An affected creature can use an action to repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. After you activate this property, roll a [[/r d6]]. On a 1-2 you can’t activate this property again until the following dawn.

Hyphal Grasp (Restrained).name: Hyphal Grasp (Restrained)
Hyphal Grasp (Restrained).description: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack using longspike within the next minute, the target must succeed on a [[/save str dc=13 format=long]] or be @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.w7eitkpD7QQTB6j0.JournalEntryPage.cSVcyZyNe2iG1fIc]{Restrained} by the magical hyphae for 1 minute. An affected creature can use an action to repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Overgrown Barkshield (Rare).name: Overgrown Barkshield (Rare)
Overgrown Barkshield (Rare).description:
Armour (shield), rare (requires attunement)

Component: Plant (treant) bark

This crude shield made of bark and wood teems with life as if it were still part of a tree. The smell of sap and various fragrant flowers perfumes the air around you.

Bark Armour. As an action, you can place the shield on your torso and speak the command word causing the wood and vines to wrap around your figure. For one hour, or until you end this effect as an action, you are unable to hold a shield and you gain the following benefits:

  • You gain [[/healing]] hit points
  • You gain the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.JPwIEfgUPVebr5AH]{Barkskin} spell (no concentration required).
  • You have advantage on saving throws made to resist being poisoned.

When this effect ends, the barkshield falls from its place on your torso, fading to a lifeless shade of grey. This property can’t be used again until you finish a long rest, when the shield blooms with life once more.

Vines and Thorns. While attuned to this shield, you can use an action to animate one of the shields’ thorny vines. Make a melee weapon attack ([[/attack]] to hit) against one target within 30 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes [[/damage]] damage and, if the target is a Large or smaller creature, or an object then weighs less than 500 pounds, you pull it up to 10 feet closer to you.

Mortiferous Pulse.name: Mortiferous Pulse
Mortiferous Pulse.description:
Class: Druid, Warlock

You summon a bolt of negative energy to stimulate and transmit necrotic pathogens into those that stand before you, decaying their internal viscera. Each creature in a 5-foot-wide, 50-foot-long line extending from you must make a [[/save dex format=long]], taking [[/damage]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

Sporespreader Staff (Rare).name: Sporespreader Staff (Rare)
Sporespreader Staff (Rare).description:
Rod, staff, or wand, rare (requires attunement by a spellcaster)

Component: Plant (hyphan) spore-filled gills

Used as a magical focus of the more humanoid-esque, ‘customer-facing’ hyphan colonists, sporespreaders are enchanted to facilitate the calming and assimila tion of would-be interlopers. The magic in these foci can poison foes with infectious spores, or generate obscuring thick black clouds to allow their wielders to flee dangerous situations.

This focus has 10 charges and regains [[/r 1d6 + 4]] expended charges daily at dawn. While holding the sporespreader, you can use an action to expend some of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability:

  • @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.eS7XnnApoxRxYXPs]{Charm Person} (1 charge)
  • @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.3MYDjS6k9IYL0aTj]{Calm Emotions} (2 charges)
  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.l0oALTQuDQJE5vKv]{Enrage} (3 charges)
  • @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.Z4YoNd8AFxiLAkwW]{Mortiferous Pulse} (2 charges)

You can also cast the @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.kFs5m2XYcAUdCcx5]{Spore Cloud} and @UUID[Compendium.heliana-core.items-heliana-the-veiled-lady-heliana-the-veiled-lady.Item.MeAHICvn9eHG5Lml]{Smokescreen} cantrips from the focus without using any charges.

Fungal Infection.name: Fungal Infection
Fungal Infection.description:
Class: Druid, Warlock, Wizard

With an exhalation, fungal spores waft their way towards a point within range. Each creature in a 15-foot-radius sphere centred on that point must succeed on a [[/save con format=long]] or become cursed until the spell ends.

When you cast the spell, choose one of the following fungi to grow on the cursed creatures:

  • Amanita Rotgut. The creature immediately takes [[/damage poison 2d6]] damage and becomes &reference[poisoned]. While poisoned in this way, the creature takes [[/damage poison 2d6]] damage at the end of each of its subsequent turns.
  • Necrotising Zygomycosis. The creature immediately takes [[/damage necrotic 2d8]] damage, and takes [[/damage necrotic 2d8]] damage at the start of each of its turns.
  • Psilocybin Quickitrippiae. The creature begins ‘tripping’. It must roll a [[/r d4]] at the start of each of its turns. On a 1, the creature doesn’t move or take actions this turn.
  • Paralysing Mucorales. At the end of each of the creature’s turns, it becomes &reference[stunned] until the start of its next turn. If the creature fails a saving throw against this spell by 5 or more then, if it would be &reference[stunned], it is &reference[paralyzed] instead.
  • Raging Henbane. The creature becomes &reference[charmed] by you and must use its reaction at the start of each of its turns to make one weapon attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach/range other than you.
  • Veiled Lady. The creature’s vision darkens to a pinhole; the creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and ranged attacks have advantage against the creature.

An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns (after the effects of this spell have triggered), ending the effect on itself on a success.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage (both initial and later) of Amanita Rotgut and Necrotising Zygomycosis increases by [[/damage 1d6]] and [[/damage 1d8]], respectively, for each slot level above 4th. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can choose two different fungi to grow on affected targets instead of one.

Amanita Rotgut.name: Amanita Rotgut
Amanita Rotgut.description: This creature is &Reference[Poisoned] and takes [[/damage 2d6 poison]] damage at the end of each of its turns. It can repeat the saving throw against this effect at the end of each of its turns after it has taken the poison damage, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Necrotising Zygomycosis.name: Necrotising Zygomycosis
Necrotising Zygomycosis.description: This creature takes [[/damage 2d8 necrotic]] damage at the start of each of its turns. It can repeat the saving throw against this effect at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Psilocybin Quickitrippiae.name: Psilocybin Quickitrippiae
Psilocybin Quickitrippiae.description: The creature begins ‘tripping’. It must roll a [[/r d4]] at the start of each of its turns. On a 1, the creature doesn’t move or take actions this turn. It can repeat the saving throw against this effect at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Paralysing Mucorales.name: Paralysing Mucorales
Paralysing Mucorales.description: At the end of each of the creature’s turns, it becomes &reference[stunned] until the start of its next turn. If the creature fails a saving throw against this spell by 5 or more then, if it would be &reference[stunned], it is &reference[paralyzed] instead. It can repeat the saving throw against this effect at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Raging Henbane.name: Raging Henbane
Raging Henbane.description: The creature becomes &reference[charmed] by you and must use its reaction at the start of each of its turns to make one weapon attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach/range other than you. It can repeat the saving throw against this effect at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Veiled Lady.name: Veiled Lady
Veiled Lady.description: The creature’s vision darkens to a pinhole; the creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and ranged attacks have advantage against the creature. It can repeat the saving throw against this effect at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Painblinder Mycaxe Handaxe (Rare).name: Painblinder Mycaxe Handaxe (Rare)
Painblinder Mycaxe Handaxe (Rare).description:
Weapon (any axe), rare

Component: Plant (hyphan) spore-filled gills

The wood and iron of this once-pristine axe has been utterly devoured and replaced by a variety of fruiting fungi. Gills funnel the axe’s blade, holding millions of spores in biomantic suspension, ready to unleash their pain-inhibiting effects when inhaled.

Painblind Spores. As a bonus action while you hold this axe, you can inhale its spores, numbing your extremities and stimulating muscle recruitment. Until the start of your next turn, melee weapon attacks you make with this weapon have a +3 bonus to damage rolls and you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

If you use your bonus action to inhale more spores at the beginning of your next turn, the effects continue without interruption. You can prolong the effects in this manner for up to 1 minute, after which the effects end. When the effects end, you become &reference[poisoned] for a number of minutes equal to ten times the number of rounds you were under the influence of the spores. While under the influence of the Painblind Spores, you have advantage on Strength and Constitution checks as well as Strength and Constitution saving throws. Once you have benefitted from the Painblind Spores, you can’t benefit from them again until after you finish a long rest.

Painblinder Spores (+3 Dam and Resistanc.name: Painblinder Spores (+3 Dam and Resistances)
Painblinder Spores (+3 Dam and Resistanc.description: Until the start of your next turn, melee weapon attacks you make with this weapon have a +3 bonus to damage rolls and you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

Infested Cultist's Skull (Very Rare).name: Infested Cultist's Skull (Very Rare)
Infested Cultist's Skull (Very Rare).description:
Wondrous item, very rare

Component: Humanoid (cultist) bone

This humanoid skull is infested by a parasitic purple plant from an unknown plane. The longer you stare, the more you could swear that the petals sway in response to an unseen wind.

The skull contains 7 petals. While holding it, you can use an action to pluck a petal to cast the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.pybg5MNc3lkerH4Y]{Blight} spell (save DC 16), dealing necrotic damage instead of radiant. The skull regrows [[/r 1d4]] plucked petals daily at dawn. If you pluck the last petal, the skull crumbles to dust and is destroyed.

Curse. This skull is cursed, and plucking 3 or more petals in a day extends this curse to you. Until the curse is broken with @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XZhdgVK3cLoxNCQl]{remove curse} or similar magic, you are unwilling to part with the skull, keeping it within reach at all times. 

While cursed, whenever you finish a long rest, a black petal grows on your head. These black petals cannot be removed physically, and any attempt to do so causes you to take [[/damage necrotic 2d6]] damage. If you travel to a different plane while cursed, you grow a further [[/r 1d4]] black petals.

When the seventh petal has grown on your skull, you die and your body turns to dust, except your skull which becomes a new infested cultist skull. If the curse is removed, the petals on your head and the infested cultist skull are destroyed and crumble to dust.

Raging Henbane.name: Raging Henbane
Raging Henbane.description:
You can eat this mushroom as an action. When you do so, you immediately gain resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 minute. At the start of each of your turns, if there is at least one creature within the reach/range of your currently-held weapon, you must immediately use your reaction to make one weapon attack against a randomly determined creature within your reach/range.

Waning Potency. This mushroom loses its potency 1 hour after it was picked.

Raging Henbane.name: Raging Henbane
Raging Henbane.description: You immediately gain resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 minute. At the start of each of your turns, if there is at least one creature within the reach/range of your currently-held weapon, you must immediately use your reaction to make one weapon attack against a randomly determined creature within your reach/range.

  • You gain the benefits of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.JPwIEfgUPVebr5AH]{Barkskin} spell (no concentration required).
  • You have advantage on saving throws made to resist being poisoned.

When this effect ends, the barkshield falls from its place on your torso, fading to a lifeless shade of grey. This property can’t be used again until you finish a long rest, when the shield blooms with life once more.

On a hit, the target takes [[/damage]] damage and, if the target is a Large or smaller creature, or an object then weighs less than 500 pounds, you pull it up to 10 feet closer to you.

Spore Cloud.name: Spore Cloud
Spore Cloud.description:
Class: Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock

You produce a cloud of virulent spores. Each creature within 5 feet of you, other than you, must succeed on a [[/save con format=long]] or take [[/damage poison 1d4]] damage. A creature that fails the saving throw by 5 or more is &reference[poisoned] until the end of its next turn.

The spell’s damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level ([[/damage 2d4]]), 11th level ([[/damage 3d4]]), and 17th level ([[/damage 4d4]]).

Spore Cloud.name: Spore Cloud
Spore Cloud.description: This creature is &Reference[Poisoned] until the end of its next turn.

Lungburst.name: Lungburst
Lungburst.description:
Class: Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard

You cause rapid and unpredictable changes in the internal air pressure of a creature you can see within range, rupturing its breathing apparatus. The creature must make a [[/save con format=long]]. A creature that is holding its breath makes this saving throw with disadvantage. On a failure, a creature takes [[/damage thunder 7d6]] damage, [[/damage necrotic 7d6]] damage, and immediately begins suffocating. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and does not begin suffocating. A creature suffocating in this way can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending its suffocation on a success.

A creature that does not need to breathe is immune to the effects of this spell. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.WzvJ7G3cqvIubsLk]{greater restoration}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.qcYitWoSMTnKkzM1]{heal}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3okM6Gn63zzEULkz]{wish} spell can restore a creature’s ability to breathe, and end its suffocation.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the thunder and necrotic damage both increase by [[/damage 1d6]] for each slot level above 6th.

Enrage.name: Enrage
Enrage.description:
Class: Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock

You attempt to create violent emotions in a group of people. Each humanoid in a 20-foot-radius sphere centred on a point you choose within range must make a [[/save cha format=long]]; a creature can choose to fail this saving throw if it wishes. A creature that fails this saving throw becomes enraged for the duration.

While enraged, a target becomes hostile towards all creatures. An enraged creature that is concentrating on a spell must succeed on a [[/save con 10 format=long]] at the start of each of its turns or lose concentration on the spell.

As an action, you can force an enraged creature to use its reaction to make one melee weapon attack against one randomly determined creature within the enraged creature’s reach. If the enraged creature was friendly towards the target of its attack before this spell was cast, the enraged creature can repeat the saving throw immediately after making the attack, ending the effect on itself on a success.

An enraged creature can repeat the saving throw whenever it takes damage, ending the effect on itself on a success. When the spell ends, the creature reverts to its previous disposition again, unless the GM rules otherwise.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher and use an action to force an enraged creature to make a melee weapon attack, you can force one additional enraged creature to make a melee weapon attack for each slot level above 3rd.

Sporespreader Staff (Uncommon).description:

An affected creature can use an action to repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Damp Dark Dweller (Hyphan).name: Damp Dark Dweller (Hyphan)
Damp Dark Dweller (Hyphan).description:
Prerequisite: 9th-level tamer, Detritivore

Type: Passive (companion & tamer)

The hyphan has immunity to necrotic damage. In addition, while the hyphan is summoned, its tamer has darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If its tamer already has darkvision, the range is increased by 30 feet.

Shackles of Pain.name: Shackles of Pain
Shackles of Pain.description:
Class: Bard, Cleric, Paladin, Warlock

You link the vitality of a willing creature within range—the source—to the psyche of another creature within range—the target. The target must succeed on a [[/save cha format=long]] or become linked to the source for 1 minute. Each time the source takes damage, the target takes psychic damage equal to half the damage the source took. If you yourself are the source, the creature takes this damage immediately before you make a Constitution saving throw to maintain your concentration. Whenever the target takes damage in this way, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

Source of Pain.name: Source of Pain
Source of Pain.description: When this creature takes damage, the target takes half of the damage as psychic damage.

Target of Pain.name: Target of Pain
Target of Pain.description: This creature takes half of the damage the source takes as psychic damage when the source takes damage.

Painblinder Mycaxe Greataxe (Rare).name: Painblinder Mycaxe Greataxe (Rare)
Painblinder Mycaxe Greataxe (Rare).description:

Ring of Fungal Symbiosis (Uncommon).name: Ring of Fungal Symbiosis (Uncommon)
Ring of Fungal Symbiosis (Uncommon).description:
Ring, uncommon (optional attunement)

Component: Plant (hyphan) pouch of spores

Parasite or symbiote, the exact classification of this loop of living fungus is up for debate. When worn for an extended period, the ring co-opts its host, produc ing an assortment of fruiting fungal bodies each day. Whether those are of benefit or not is entirely up to how they’re used.

Whenever you finish a long rest during which you wear this ring, you find a selection of toadstools have grown on the limb that sports this ring. Roll a [[/r d4]] twice and consult the list below to determine which two mushrooms have grown.

  • Boomshroom. As an action a creature can throw this volatile mushroom at a point it can see within 60 feet of it, where it explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere. Each creature in the area must make a [[/save dex dc= 13 format=long]], taking [[/damage fire 4d6]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren’t being worn or carried.
  • Bloomshroom. As an action a creature can eat this mushroom, regaining [[/healing 2d4 + 2]] hit points and gaining advantage on all Constitution saving throws for 1 minute.
  • Doomshroom. As an action a creature can throw this dusky mushroom at a point it can see within 60 feet of it, where it explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere of purple spores. Each creature in the area must succeed on a [[/save con dc= 13 format=long]] or become afflicted by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.95K2aUhAGV9qXjnf]{Bane} spell for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect for it on a success.
  • Gloomshroom. As an action a creature can eat this mushroom. For the next hour, it gains @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.eVtpEGXjA2tamEIJ.JournalEntryPage.0RBamBThjzeAdMSt]{Darkvision} out to a range of 60 feet. If it already has @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.rules.eVtpEGXjA2tamEIJ.JournalEntryPage.0RBamBThjzeAdMSt]{Darkvision}, the range of this vision is extended by 30 feet.

The mushrooms last on your arm until you next finish a long rest, but lose all magical effects after 10 minutes after they are plucked. You can pluck a mushroom as part of the action to use it.

Optional Attunement. You can choose to attune to this item. While attuned, you can roll the d4 to determine which mushrooms grow four times instead of twice.

Darkvision.name: 黑暗视觉
Darkvision.description: As an action a creature can eat this mushroom. For the next hour, it gains Darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If it already has Darkvision, the range of this vision is extended by 30 feet.

Bane.name: 灾祸
Bane.description: 在法术结束前，该目标进行的攻击检定或豁免检定都必须从检定结果中减去 1d4。

Mycelial Cloak (Rare).name: Mycelial Cloak (Rare)
Mycelial Cloak (Rare).description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

Component: Plant (hyphan) membrane

This hearty-scented cape is knitted from microscopic threads of autumn-hued mycelia. With alarming rapidity, the hyphae can drain a corpse, leaving it an emaciated husk and restoring its wearer to robust, good health.

Detritivore. As a bonus action you can target one Small or larger corpse or one small or larger creature with 0 hit points you can see within 15 feet of you, causing your mycelia to burrow over to it and rapidly drain it of nutrients. If the target is alive it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or fail a death saving throw. Undead have disadvantage on this saving throw. On a failure, or if the target is a corpse, you regain [[/healing 6d6]] hit points. After you activate this feature, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

Mycelial Deconstruction. As an action you can wrap the cloak around yourself, causing your body and all the items you are wearing or holding to dissolve into thousands of mycelial threads. You gain a burrowing speed equal to your walking speed, you can burrow through nonmagical unworked earth and stone, and you don’t disturb the material you move through.

While in this form you can pass through any microscopic gap large enough for a fungal hypha; have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage; and can’t talk, manipulate objects, cast spells, or attack. You can reform in an unoccupied space as an action. After you activate this feature, you can’t do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

Mycelial Reconstitution (Hyphan).name: Mycelial Reconstitution (Hyphan)
Mycelial Reconstitution (Hyphan).description:
Prerequisite: 17th-level tamer

Type: Active (action)

As an action, the hyphan can dissolve into mycelia, ending the grappled and restrained conditions on it and reappearing in an unoccupied space on the ground it can see within 30 feet of it.

Lady's Veil (Common).name: Lady's Veil (Common)
Lady's Veil (Common).description:
Wondrous item, common (socketable, requires attunement)

This fine-meshed shroud can be socketed on any worn headgear or armour, such as a helmet, cloak, breastplate, or crown. Looking through the mesh, an attuned wearer can detect corpses and creatures ripe for decomposition.

As an action, you can open your awareness to magically detect corpses and undead. Until the end of your next turn, you know the location of any corpse or undead creature within 60 feet of you that isn’t behind total cover and that isn’t protected from divination magic. This sense doesn’t tell you anything about a creature’s capabilities or identity. After you activate this property, you can’t do so again until the following dawn.

Painblinder Mycaxe Handaxe (Uncommon).name: Painblinder Mycaxe Handaxe (Uncommon)
Painblinder Mycaxe Handaxe (Uncommon).description:
Weapon (any axe), uncommon

Component: Plant (hyphan) spore-filled gills

The wood and iron of this once-pristine axe has been utterly devoured and replaced by a variety of fruiting fungi. Gills funnel the axe’s blade, holding millions of spores in biomantic suspension, ready to unleash their pain-inhibiting effects when inhaled.

Painblind Spores. As a bonus action while you hold this axe, you can inhale its spores, numbing your extremities and stimulating muscle recruitment. Until the start of your next turn, melee weapon attacks you make with this weapon have a +2 bonus to damage rolls and you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

If you use your bonus action to inhale more spores at the beginning of your next turn, the effects continue without interruption. You can prolong the effects in this manner for up to 1 minute, after which the effects end. When the effects end, you become &reference[poisoned] for a number of minutes equal to ten times the number of rounds you were under the influence of the spores. Once you have benefitted from the Painblind Spores, you can’t benefit from them again until after you finish a long rest.

Painblinder Spores (+2 Dam and Resistanc.name: Painblinder Spores (+2 Dam and Resistances)
Painblinder Spores (+2 Dam and Resistanc.description: Until the start of your next turn, melee weapon attacks you make with this weapon have a +2 bonus to damage rolls and you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

Noradreno Mucorales.name: Noradreno Mucorales
Noradreno Mucorales.description:
You can eat this mushroom as an action. When you do so, you are immediately affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Szvk5FEVQW3uhJi5]{haste} spell for 1 minute. At the start of each of your turns while you are affected by the mushroom, you must succeed on a [[/save con dc=15 format=long]] or be unable to move or take actions until the start of your next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over you.

Waning Potency. This mushroom loses its potency 1 hour after it was picked.

Noradreno Mucorales.description: You are affected by the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.Szvk5FEVQW3uhJi5]{haste} spell for 1 minute. At the start of each of your turns while you are affected by the mushroom, you must succeed on a [[/save con dc=15 format=long]] or be unable to move or take actions until the start of your next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over you.

Haste.name: 加速术
Haste.description: 直至法术终止前，施法者使你速度翻倍；你的 AC 获得 +2 加值；你进行敏捷豁免时具有优势；你的每一回合都可作出一个额外的动作，但该动作只能用于执行攻击（只限一次武器攻击），或者疾行、撤离、躲藏和使用物件动作。

Puffballs II (Hyphan).name: Puffballs II (Hyphan)
Puffballs II (Hyphan).description:
Prerequisite: 13th-level tamer, Puffballs I

Type: Active (action)

When the hyphan uses its Puffballs action, it can create an additional 10-foot square of puffball mushrooms, for a total of four 10-foot squares. The damage they deal increases to [[/damage 4d12 average]]. The hyphan gains a +1 bonus to the save DC of this action.

When the hyphan’s tamer reaches 17th level in the tamer class, the hyphan can create one additional 10-foot square of puffballs (five total), and the damage increases to [[/damage 5d12 average]].
